page.title: 14Redlynch Birds Observed
page.content: A record is kept of birds seen around the school and food is put out during the winter. Winter visitors include redwing, fieldfare and siskin. Nesting species include blackbird, starling, house sparrow and house martin. Mistle thrush and spotted flycatchers nest in the churchyard and blue tits use boxes put up by the children. In addition to rook, jackdaw, collared dove, wood pigeon, pheasant, magpie, wren, greenfinch, chaffinch, robin, dunnock, pied wagtail, great tit and swift, the school has been visited by cuckoo, heron, kestrel, buzzard and Canada goose. A sparrow hawk which attacked birds feeding on the table, caused a blue tit to enter the class room where it died, presumably of shock.
